attributes.action: Encourage recycling through larger recycling boxes and fortnightly grey bin collections for every council
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
TIP THE BALANCE TOWARDS RECYCLING 


Let’s face it - the majority of household waste can be recycled. Furthermore, it hardly takes any effort from us to place our newspapers, bottles/cans etc into a recycling box. 

Taxing us for the amount of rubbish we create (by weight), on top of the Council Tax we pay for having a waste collection service in the first place, would obviously be unfair.  

So to encourage people to get into a regular routine of recycling: 

-  EVERY COUNCIL should introduce new LARGER RECYCLING BOXES to accommodate greater amounts of recyclable waste. 

-  And FORTNIGHTLY GREY BIN COLLECTIONS of non-recyclable waste.

An easy, cost-effective way to get the green balance right.
